# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the requested function:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[- ]", "_")
end
```
This function uses three built-in Julia functions: `lowercase`, which converts all uppercase letters to lowercase, `strip` which removes leading and trailing whitespaces, and `replace` which replaces spaces or hyphens with underscores. The regex pattern `r"[- ]"` is used to match either a space or a hyphen.
